issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw:
While doing the pull request #608 I ported the performance test  (atlas urdf parsing) to gazebo_1.8 branch. Results:

**gazebo_1.8 branch**
```
[----------] 1 test from URDFParser
[ RUN      ] URDFParser.AtlasURDF_5runs_performance
[       OK ] URDFParser.AtlasURDF_5runs_performance (136 ms)
[----------] 1 test from URDFParser (137 ms total)
```
**default branch**
```
[----------] 1 test from URDFParser
[ RUN      ] URDFParser.AtlasURDF_5runs_performance
Warning [parser_urdf.cc:226] multiple inconsistent <pose> exists due to fixed joint reduction overwriting previous value [0 0 0.93 0 0 0] with [0 0 0 0 -0 0].

[       OK ] URDFParser.AtlasURDF_5runs_performance (1568 ms)
[----------] 1 test from URDFParser (1568 ms total)
```

issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw: I think striking [this call to InsertRobotOrigin](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/222b5b368663a4ad7a8cd3acd8c83d1a5ea652ca/gazebo/sdf/interface/parser_urdf.cc?at=default#cl-1904) fixes the issue for me.  If so, this is a problem with starting the robot at the wrong location (e.g. submerged in ground plane).  Please confirm.  Thanks.
content.html: I think striking this call to InsertRobotOrigin fixes the issue for me. If so, this is a problem with starting the robot at the wrong location (e.g. submerged in ground plane). Please confirm. Thanks.

issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw:
In [sdformat pull request #7](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/7), Steve and I [added logic](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/956f0feb5ecf873cb205e6b63b6883925f670554) to avoid that call when the origin pose isn't set in the input file.  We did that because (at least in some worlds), Atlas would start embedded in the ground plane.

With that change, the robot starts in the right place, but performance is still pretty bad.

Using gazebo-prerelase-1.9.3 (released from the gazebo_1.9 branch, which is up-to-date with default), sdformat-1.4.2, and drcsim (built from source using the rml branch), I get the following RTF numbers on my desktop:

* atlas.launch: 0.92
* atlas_sandia_hands.launch: 0.55
* vrc_task_1.launch: 0.08
* vrc_task_2.launch: 0.01
* vrc_task_3.launch: 0.07
content.html:
In sdformat pull request #7, Steve and I added logic to avoid that call when the origin pose isn't set in the input file. We did that because (at least in some worlds), Atlas would start embedded in the ground plane.

With that change, the robot starts in the right place, but performance is still pretty bad.

Using gazebo-prerelase-1.9.3 (released from the gazebo_1.9 branch, which is up-to-date with default), sdformat-1.4.2, and drcsim (built from source using the rml branch), I get the following RTF numbers on my desktop:

  • atlas.launch: 0.92
  • atlas_sandia_hands.launch: 0.55
  • vrc_task_1.launch: 0.08
  • vrc_task_2.launch: 0.01
  • vrc_task_3.launch: 0.07

issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw:
More support for @iche033 's assertion that pull request #559 is to blame:

* Building gazebo from eea487f28348, just *before* merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, `atlas_sandia_hands.launch` gives RTF of 0.85.
* Building gazebo from 251d77807aea, just *after* merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, `atlas_sandia_hands.launch` gives RTF of 0.60.  

As a side note, in the second configuration, I also commented out the [call to InsertRobotOrigin](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/222b5b368663a4ad7a8cd3acd8c83d1a5ea652ca/gazebo/sdf/interface/parser_urdf.cc?at=default#cl-1904) so that the robot wouldn't be embedded in ground plane.

Anybody have a guess as to what in that pull request would affect performance?
content.html:
More support for @iche033 's assertion that pull request #559 is to blame:

  • Building gazebo from eea487f28348, just before merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, atlas_sandia_hands.launch gives RTF of 0.85.
  • Building gazebo from 251d77807aea, just after merging pull request #559, plus drcsim from the drcsim_2.6 branch, atlas_sandia_hands.launch gives RTF of 0.60.

As a side note, in the second configuration, I also commented out the call to InsertRobotOrigin so that the robot wouldn't be embedded in ground plane.

Anybody have a guess as to what in that pull request would affect performance?

issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw:
Profile data from `perf`, in both cases running `perf record gzserver -s libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so atlas_sandia_hands.world`, with a `roscore` running:

Top consumers as of eea487f28348:
~~~
 29.90%  gzserver  libgazebo_ode.so.1.8.2                  [.] 0x7dfd4
 10.46%  gzserver  [kernel.kallsyms]                       [k] 0xffffffff8103e0ca
~~~

Top consumers as of 251d77807aea:
~~~
 17.13%  gzserver  libgazebo_ode.so.1.8.2                  [.] 0x7dc8e
 15.77%  gzserver  libstdc++.so.6.0.16                     [.] std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::basic_string(std::string const&)
 12.07%  gzserver  libstdc++.so.6.0.16                     [.] 0x9ebc8
  8.14%  gzserver  [kernel.kallsyms]                       [k] 0xffffffff8103e0ca
  5.39%  gzserver  libgazebo_physics.so.1.8.2              [.] gazebo::physics::Base::GetByName(std::string const&)
~~~

Looks like we introduced some profligate string handling.
content.html:
Profile data from perf, in both cases running perf record gzserver -s libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so atlas_sandia_hands.world, with a roscore running:

Top consumers as of eea487f28348:

 29.90%  gzserver  libgazebo_ode.so.1.8.2                  [.] 0x7dfd4
 10.46%  gzserver  [kernel.kallsyms]                       [k] 0xffffffff8103e0ca

Top consumers as of 251d77807aea:

 17.13%  gzserver  libgazebo_ode.so.1.8.2                  [.] 0x7dc8e
 15.77%  gzserver  libstdc++.so.6.0.16                     [.] std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::basic_string(std::string const&)
 12.07%  gzserver  libstdc++.so.6.0.16                     [.] 0x9ebc8
  8.14%  gzserver  [kernel.kallsyms]                       [k] 0xffffffff8103e0ca
  5.39%  gzserver  libgazebo_physics.so.1.8.2              [.] gazebo::physics::Base::GetByName(std::string const&)

Looks like we introduced some profligate string handling.

issue.title: Compiling drcsim against gazebo default branch produces very low real time factor

content.raw:
@scpeters tracked it down to repeatedly failing name lookups for collision bodies with the suffix `_collision`; the new parser was using the suffix `_geom` instead.

Fixed by reverting the parser to use `_collision` in two places:

* pull request #612 fixes gazebo/default
* [sdformat pull request #11](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/11) fixes sdformat/1.4
content.html:
@scpeters tracked it down to repeatedly failing name lookups for collision bodies with the suffix _collision; the new parser was using the suffix _geom instead.

Fixed by reverting the parser to use _collision in two places:

  • pull request #612 fixes gazebo/default
  • sdformat pull request #11 fixes sdformat/1.4
